pages.text: Landing on a new planet requires skill and caution. The landing system helps you descend safely, but you must still control your approach.

pages.title: Descent Phase
pages.text: When approaching a planet:$(br)$(br)1. The rocket begins automatic descent$(br)2. Atmospheric entry may cause effects$(br)3. You regain control during landing$(br)4. Use SPACE to slow descent$(br)5. Touch down gently!$(br)$(br)Hard landings may damage the rocket.

pages.title: After Landing
pages.text: Once you land:$(br)$(br)1. Exit the lander to retrieve rocket and supplies$(br)2. Check your oxygen supply$(br)3. Put on space suit if needed$(br)4. Mark your rocket location$(br)5. Begin exploration!
